thread.title: Social media users support woman rejected for job at Boots for 'not dressing conservatively enough'
thread.title_full: Social media users support woman rejected for job at Boots for 'not dressing conservatively enough'

author: Helena Horton
title: Social media users support woman rejected for job at Boots for 'not dressing conservatively enough'
text:
Social media users support woman rejected for job at Boots for 'not dressing conservatively enough' Rosie Reilly said she was rejected for her outfit Credit: Twitter Helena Horton 7 March 2017 • 3:11pm 
P eople have responded with anger after a 26-year-old was rejected from a job at Boots for "not dressing conservatively enough". 
Rosie Reilly had applied for a job as a full-time sales assistant and turned up to the interview wearing a black and white high-collared blouse and a knee length black skirt. 
After the interview, she was told she could not progress to the second stage because of the way she was dressed. 
She tweeted: "Hi Boots UK. I wasn't allowed to continue with my interview today because I wasn't dressed 'conservatively enough'. I thought I looked nice!" Hi @BootsUK . I wasn't allowed to continue with my interview today because I wasn't dressed "conservatively enough". I thought I looked nice! pic.twitter.com/dB8OerYQND — Rosie (@rsiereilly) March 6, 2017 
H er tweet has been retweeted over 700 times, and people have flocked to show their support. 
One supporter tweeted: "Making a decision on a candidate for a position should be based on their skills and knowledge, not on how they look." You look absolutely fine, smart and tidy! @rsiereilly . Did @BootsUK tell you what they considered to be wrong with your appearance? — WEP Brighton (@WEPBrighton) March 7, 2017 @rsiereilly @seafoamghost @BootsUK um... that's a black and white blouse and a knee length skirtwhat do boots want, exactly? — impeach melba (@thestooshie) March 6, 2017 @rsiereilly you look great and absolutely interview appropriate! Whoever was the hiring manager for @BootsUK needs some retraining i think.
